title: Tomasz Konina
text:
Tomasz Konina (23 June 1972 – 26 August 2017) was a Polish <a href="theatre">theatre</a> and <a href="opera">opera</a> <a href="Theatre%20director">director</a> and <a href="Scenic%20design">stage designer</a>.
Biography.
Born in <a href="Warsaw">Warsaw</a>, <a href="Poland">Poland</a> in 1972, Konina graduated from the National Academy of Dramatic Art in Warsaw in 1996.
He made both his theatre and opera debut in 1998: <a href="Anton%20Chekhov">Chekhov's</a> "<a href="Uncle%20Vanya">Uncle Vanya</a>" at the <a href="Ateneum%20Theatre">Teatr Ateneum</a> in Warsaw and <a href="Wolfgang%20Amadeus%20Mozart">Mozart's</a> "<a href="The%20Marriage%20of%20Figaro">Marriage of Figaro</a>" at the <a href="Wroc%C5%82aw%20Opera">Wrocław Opera</a>.
In 2002 he was granted the scholarship of Vilar Young Artists Programme (presently: Jette Parker Young Artists Programme) at the <a href="Royal%20Opera%20House">Royal Opera House Covent Garden</a> in London.
Graduate of the University of Economics in <a href="Wroc%C5%82aw">Wrocław</a> (Managerial Postgraduate Studies on Business Management, Institute of Contemporary Management, at the Faculty of Management, 2013).
From 2007 to 2015 he was the artistic and executive director of the <a href="Jan%20Kochanowski">Jan Kochanowski</a> Dramatic Theater in <a href="Opole">Opole</a>.

He has enabled many theatrical debuts for people who have later become recognised artists, such as , Paweł Świątek and Jędrzej Piaskowski.
